content.description: A good warm up route (along with Mondo Freako on the same wall, just to the left). Pocketed face past 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: There is a short wall on the south side of the canyon, before entering the main walls of Atlantis. There are two routes on this wall, this is the one on the right.

climbs.name: U.S. Senators Are Space Aliens
climbs.fa: Mark Harris, Jay Clark, Eric Agaciewski (1993)

content.description: This route has its first two bolts on an arete  several feet right of where the actual climbing happens out left. The crux is off the third bolt which leads to easy ground. The climbing over a bulge on the last bolt is non-trivial (tho easier then the crux below). Reasonably clean, though the move structure is just "okay".
content.protection: 6 bolts. It would have been nice if the first couple of bolts were where the climbing was- who likes to swing when falling? Though the climbing up to the 1st bolt is easier then it appears, the consequences of falling before it would not be pretty (some might prefer stick-clipping). One should also take care on the last bolt as if one were to come off (something breaking or lead falling) there's a tasty ledge that the 1st ascentionists failed to consider. The bolts at the top anchor had nothing on them to allow any rap or lower (we set up two pieces of climbing rope, a chain repair link and a 'biner). The anchor now is long enough to hang away from the wall but considering the origional setup and location, we could only shake our heads. Whoever removed the slings or chains obviously was able to scramble/walk off to the southeast and descend the gully but it looks hairball what with loose rock (much or which we removed by the anchor).
content.location: Route is to the right and across a gully from Diaper Rash on the south side of the creek, maybe 20' east and upstream of the small dam.

climbs.name: The Trident
climbs.fa: FKA: Matt Johnson, Michael Genovese, Troy Dixon

content.protection:
Protection: Bolts, Pitons, chains 

  P1: 5 draws plus your anchor gear. The final 25 feet is 5.easy so we didn't waste bolts. If you're scared, bring a set of stoppers and an extra draw. 

  P2: 9 draws, anchor gear 

  P3: 4 draws, again a set of stoppers and an extra draw or two if the 5.easy runout on top scares you.
content.location: From the Atlantis Parking lot the upper half of the route is plainly and resplendently in view. Head down the trail to the creekbed. Instead of heading left into the slot canyon, cross the creekbed and up to the base of the slab with the twin 40ft 5.7s. (approach is 10 minutes max) Start on the left one, Mondo Freako. Theoretically you could start on the one on the right but we haven't cleaned above that so don't climb it unless you're prepared for loose conditions.

content.description: This is the huge overhung chimney visible just above Atlantis when driving back to Phx from the Pond.  It is kinda spooky looking, shady east facing wall.  Climbs like a trad route with bolts.  Crux is difficult stemming to pass the roof.
content.protection:
You could bring gear for the second pitch but I don't recommend it. A couple of extendable draws and quick draws (10 total).

 First anchor shares top with Black & Tan on a small ledge. Second is great big ledge where I hang the We Love Oak Flat banner. Rappels are easy on first two pitches. If you go to the top its a short rappel but difficult pull.

 Last rappel puts you on a precarious ledge just right of the start.
content.location: Walk up stream from Atlantis main area to just around the corner, work your way up about 100ft to base of overhanging chimney.  The route goes up the broken face passing two bolts to gain the chimney.  Another route exists just right on the face to the same anchor.  It's called Black & Tan.

content.description: Climb the crack approximately 30' up to a ledge.  The climbing to the ledge is low 5th class with no bolts, however, you could place some pro in the crack if you like.  Clip the first bolt after you reach the ledge and proceed up the bolted face.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor with rap rings
content.location: This route is on your right, just before you enter the main walls of the canyon. It is Right and around the corner of Bunny Slope (5.8) and just left of Hide and Seek crack (5.7 trad) and Ali Cat (5.7 sport).

content.description: Excellent climb located in the Atlantis area. Start below a large, steep bulge and move up to a ledge with thin crimps and a high pocket. Thin holds transition into a committing move to a large dish (crux). Continue up overhung face to easier vertical section above and anchors. Moving to the left of the bolt line would drop the grade. The climb has a reputation among locals as one of the best in Queen Creek and a must-do for those visiting The Road area.
content.protection: 7 bolts; well protected. 2 shut rap or lower-off.
content.location: Quad-fold guide available for "The Road Area" of Queen Creek is highly recommended to locate this route and others in the area with ease.

climbs.name: See You Try, See You Fail

content.description: Easy start up bucket pockets to a high first bolt. Nasty fall if you blow it, but the holds are positive and pretty mellow. More pockets and edges lead through a couple more bolts. After, make a hard left along a rail to join the "Direct" route."
content.protection: Glue in bolts. Rings up top.
content.location: On the backside face of the rock which Micky Mouse resides. From the canyon mouth, walk uphill and south past Ali Cat, the Trident/Mondo Freako. The route begins in the notch with new glue in bolts. Left route is the direct start, right line of bolts is SYT, SYF.

climbs.name: The Phoenix
climbs.fa: A Collins S.Dumler A.Wehn S. Rutherford

content.description: You can start on the first 2 bolts of Ali cat then step right of the corner and head up the bolted face between the crack and a tree passing 5 bolts to the obvious belay from a dirty ledge in the giant chimney. Or scramble up to the ledge and belay from the base of the wall skipping anything to do with Ali cat. There are a lot of loose rocks at the base of the climb and you can send one down on a belayer on Ali cat so be careful!Pitch two:follow 5 bolts up the steep face (Crux 1) that eases to a massive ledge with rap rings under a roof.Pitch three:climb past 5 bolts through the Roof (Crux 2) to rap rings.you can either rap each pitch or do I two raps.
content.protection: Set of draws
content.location: Look for the shiniest bolts that go to the sky 15' up and right of Ali

content.description: Angle to the right from just below First Born/Double Exposure. Hard/tricky just after 3rd bolt and going over the 4th then it gets easier again. Funky moves at the last two bolts through the crack/chimney. Long route, 60m rope or tie knots on a 50m when rappelling.
content.protection: Bolts (9) with chains at the top. For toproping leave the last 2 draws clipped and your rope will run well.
content.location: To the left of KGB. Start is almost directly below the chimney of First Born on a ledge. Angle up and to the right for the 1st 3 bolts then head up past 6 more. Climber goes out of sight after small roof with obvious 2 hand pocket (great undercling).

content.description: Climb the start of Overbearing Underminer, after the vertical crimpy face, climb through a sea of jugs to a break. You have the option to go straight up through the chimney which is Overbearing Underminder, instead use a long runner on the bolt and head left to the roof section of Double Exposure. The roof has broken in years past and involves a big move off of a left hand sidepull crimp (VERY WORTHY movement), or cheat out left and climb big lay back jugs to the anchor of Double Exposure.
content.protection: Bolts, Bolted Anchors, bring one long alpine draw
content.location: Starts Overbearing Underminer, finishes Double Exposure

content.description: Short climb up a pocketed face.  Nothing particularly special except perhaps a nice easy warm-up route.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: There is a short wall on the south side of the canyon, before entering the main walls of Atlantis.     There are two routes on this wall, this is the one on the left.

content.description: Scramble up a broken section past a tree to a ledge. Climb the arete to a  2 bolt rap. First move off the deck has some exposure.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the 'fin', rock-right of Mondo Freako and Unknown (5.6?).

content.description: Climb the arete past several bolts.  The crux is near the bottom, making a reachy move up and left to a nice pocket, then up and right on smaller holds to a decent rest on the arete.  Cruise on nice holds to the top.
content.protection: Well bolted.
content.location: Located a bit upstream, just past the dam, on the south side (opposite of the road) on a nice arete.

content.description: KGB has, I think, two crux sections.  The first is the thin face near the start and the second is pulling the roof.  This is a delicate climb with fun moves and sustained pulling.  A good rest under the roof enables the on-sight or redpoint.
content.protection: Seven bolts, two shut anchor.  Well bolted.
content.location: Creek-left, KGB can be spotted on your right as you enter the corridor of the waterfall area.  Look for the short roof 60 up.

content.description: Just as you enter the canyon from the trail, on the right side of the canyon, about 10 feet to the right of Sir Charles is a hand crack up mostly good rock. A bit loose in a couple spots but at this grade you won't be pulling down hard. Mostly 5.5/5.6 climbing. Great for the beginning trad leader. Great Pro whenever you need it. Lots of pockets and stances
content.protection: doubles .3 to #4, #5 optional (BD sizes), 2 long runners nice. Two Bolt Anchor (shared with Ali Cat) with rap rings.

content.description: The bulging face is probably the crux.  Bucket  pockets and rails makes this a fun, albeit a bit pumpy climb.  A scrambling start to a ledge before the route kicks in.
content.protection: Six bolts; well protected.  Two-shut anchor.
content.location: W-NW facing, this climb is mostly in the shade; we climbed in mid June.  Left of KBG and left of the bolted (5.8) chimney.

climbs.name: Gluten Intolerance
climbs.fa: Jacob Marcy, Jackson SimsMyers, Ben Ramsey

content.description: medium to large size holds of various qualities (mostly Slopers, crimps, jugs, pockets and side pulls). a 12' start to the first clip. The crux is difficult to determine given its" characteristics. The route can be thought of a sustained boulder problem. This route provides a pumpy experience,, leaving your muscles burning more than your tendons/ligaments.
content.protection: Bolts/Leaf Hangars, Quick links and Rings
content.location: Toward the right side of the entrance to the Funny Farm, a lone pillar stands with a large anchor attached for a guy wire supporting the old water pipe that led toward Magma Mine.

content.description: Great moderate climb! As with other routes in Atlantis, features a variety of holds and moves that keep it interesting and allow creative climbing. Ledges, pockets, underclings, pinches. It's a great warmup, especially if some of the shorter warmup/beginner routes are occupied.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolts w/ chains and mussy hooks
content.location: To the right of KGB and to the left of Bunny Slope.

content.description: Low angle face. Enjoyable climb.  A little thin going past 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Across the creek from the approach trail, on the  main wall before entering the canyon. Right of Mondo Freako

content.description: This Route has everything from the chimney, stemming and face climbing.  It does wander a bit though so it may not be the best top rope option.
content.protection: Many bolts to chains
content.location: Start as same as double exposure left of KGB.

content.description:
Fun little 4 bolt face with some awesome pockets and jugs. Well protected. Good route for a new leader.

 Here's to great friends and coping with emotion.
content.protection: 4 bolt face, 2 bolt anchor
content.location: South side of the creek, just past the approach trail for the Funny Farm. Around the corner from Gluten Intolerance(climbers right), on the west face up the gully.

climbs.name: Double Trouble
climbs.fa: FA in ? Scott D, 2nd in 2020 Ben A

content.description: Slick start through broken cracks to an epic double crack up to a small Bush. At the bush climb right onto the face for the anchors of shoot first ask later!
content.protection: .4 - #3 friends, a set of nuts, and some slings!
content.location: The start is in between The 2 bolted lines Shoot First Ask Later and  US Senators Are Space Aliens. Head up the obvious line of pro to the prominent double crack!

content.description: This climb has lots of variety. It starts the same as First Born to the left of KGB.  The 2 distinct roofs are easy to notice.
content.protection: Many bolts to chains.
content.location: Left of KGB, start at First Born, another  recent first ascent (not in guidebooks) by Scott.

content.description: A key two finger, one pad right hand under-cling got me through the crux.  Nice climb.  Short, but nice.
content.protection: Six bolts, open shut anchors
content.location: Located on the back side of the SW feature (climbers left of Mickey Mouse, up the hill from Mondo Freako)

climbs.name: Diaper Rash
climbs.fa: Marky Mark Harris, Jay Clark & Eric Agaciewski 3/93

content.description: Although a fun climb, the suspect rock on this climb makes it a bit freaky on lead.  A runout section above the second bolt makes a ground fall potential.
content.protection: Five bolts.  Hangers on top; one with a quick link, the other with Marcy's biner.
content.location: Not sure where the crux is.  Certainly a bit heady moving up past the second bolt (because of the runout).

content.description: Short but fun route. Stem up the dihedral and achieve a lovely rail directly beneath the roof. The 4th bolt is not visible from the ground, but it's directly above the 3rd bolt after you pull the roof. Navigate a small bulge and it's smooth sailing from there.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: On the west corner of the short blocky formation about 100 meters down stream from the entrance to Atlantis. Around the corner from gluten intolerance. Follow the old rusty pipe. Scramble up a short scree chute and step left above a small semi dead ironwood.

content.description: Follow the thin, slightly less than vertical face past some fun moves, but plenty of flexing holds and friable rock.  Step left at the end to clip the anchors for Slap & Tickle
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor.  There is a head height bolt on the ledge for the belayer.
content.location: Start a on ledge a few feet to the right of Slap & Tickle.

content.description: Just right of the crack route "Hide and Seek" on a long broken pillar. It looks like the rock won't be great but actually it's good. fairly steep but is so full of jugs and edges it stays easy.
content.protection: 9 bolts, shares anchor with Hide and Seek (2 bolt anchor with rap rings)
content.location: Just before you enter main Atlantis area go right to rock face on other side of wash, you will find hide and seek, this route, then further up a little are a couple of short, easy sport lines as well.

content.description:
These routes encompass all of the routes on the south side of the canyon. The south side tends to host a greater number of vertical and moderate routes than the north side.  

  Routes like Mickey Mouse, G-string, the Trident, and Ali Cat all start outside of the mouth of the canyon. A few routes like Slap and Tickle and the Mangler are located above the dam. All the others are in the guts of the canyon. 

  You'll find solid rock on all of the well traveled routes, but expect the occasional potato chip flake. 

  AM Shade / PM Sun
